file_content.text: The beacon destroyed. Comm signals still jammed. And a fierce storm coming our way.
The GenoHaradan must have a camp nearby. We can ride out the storm there.
Let's find shelter.
It's likely the camp is heavily guarded.
It won't be once we're done.
We'll fix that.
Looks like the storm's not letting up anytime soon. I say we grab a shuttle and head out now.
The interference will disable comms and scanners. Not to mention the risk of an electrical surge frying our circuits.
Shan. I just heard the news. Let me express my sincere condolences.
SIS reporting has gone downhill since I left. The commander is missing, not dead.
Don't let foolish hope blind you. You are leaderless, as are the Sith. Someone must step in to fill the void.
Forgive me, but aren't you the former Republic chancellor? You've already served your term.
True leaders don't need titles to hold power. I want what your leader wanted: to defeat Vaylin.
Join me, and we can finish what she started.
Join me, and we can finish what he started.
Pass. I've had more than my fill of working with you.
You're still grieving. Eventually, you'll realize I'm right.
Storm be damned, the time for patience is past. Let's find the commander.
Even the weather is trying to kill us.
This keeps getting better.
We haven't destroyed the last of our enemies.
Someone is still after us.
I assume the GenoHaradan have a camp nearby. That should be our destination.
We could take refuge in the GenoHaradan camp, if we can find it.
Look at this as an adventure.
Try to think positive.
Nothing like a little danger to get the heart racing.
[Flirt] I like the action.
That is not reassuring.
I admire your persistence, but let's focus on our survival, shall we?
